mdRecord.dcterms:title: [Plans and sections of batteries on the main line of enemy's works in front of Petersburg, Va / Headquarters Army of the Potomac, Engineer Department, Oct. 20, 1864 ; Julius Bien & Co., Lith., N.Y.]
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Julius Bien & Co.
Michler, N. (Nathaniel), 1827-1881
United States. Army. Corps of Engineers.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: 1. E. No. 5. Batteries Nos. 9 and 10 -- 2. E. No. 6. Nos. 11,12 and 13... -- 3. E. No. 7. Batteries Nos. 14 and 15... -- 4. E. No. 9. Batteries Nos. 17, 18 and 19.... -- 5. E. No. 8. Battery No. 16... -- 6. E. No. 10. Battery No. 20... -- 7. E. No. 11. Batteries Nos. 21 and 22... -- 8. D. No. 2. Siege of Petersburg, Va. From July 9th to July 31st., 1864. Field Battery... -- 9. E. No. 2. Batteries Nos. 3,4 and A... -- 10. E. No. 3. Battery No. 5... -- 11. E. No. 4. Batteries Nos. 6,7 and 8... -- 12. D. No. 5. Siege of Petersburg, Va. from July 9th to July 31st., 1864. Fort Davis...
Without collective title, which was constructed by the cataloger from the titles of the individual plans.
From: Atlas to accompany the Official records of the Union and Confederate Armies, 1861-1865, Plate CIV.
Lower left corner of each plan: Accompanying the report of Maj. N. Michler, Corps of Engrs. U.S. Army. Series 1 Vol. XL. Part 1 page 294.
